Package com.xhive.query.interfaces

This package contains the X-Hive query interfaces.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
XhiveQueryResultIf Represents an XPath/XPointer query result.
XhiveXQueryExtensionFunctionIf Interface for user written XQuery extensions.
XhiveXQueryQueryIf XhiveXQueryQueryIf represents a parsed query.
XhiveXQueryValueIf Represents an XQuery unit value.
 

Class Summary
XhiveXQueryParam Deprecated. The usage of this class is deprecated in favor of XhiveXQueryQueryIf.setVariable(String, boolean) et al.
 

Package com.xhive.query.interfaces Description

This package contains the X-Hive query interfaces. Most of the interfaces in this package are deprecated since X-Hive 3.0. Users are advised to avoid the usage of these interfaces.

In general users can best use XQuery queries in favor of XPath queries where possible (A great number of XPath queries are also valid XQuery queries), since XQuery offers the best performance in most cases. XQuery queries can be executed using the executeXQuery methods in the XhiveLibraryChildId interface.

The functionality of the deprecated interfaces is now available through the executeXPath and executeXPointer methods on the XhiveNodeIf interface. XPath/XPointer contexts with additional function/namespace/variable declarations can be created using the XhiveXPathContextIf interface.
